intro: Matelea costaricensis, commonly known as the Costarica mallow, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in the understory of forests.
